title: Bridging Into Family Support
abstractText:
The ESRC Families & Social Capital research group studies the relationship between family change and social capital, as values, networks and resources. This project aims to enable the group to improve communication and dissemination of findings to a wide audience of practitioners working in the field of family support. Specifically, the group will work in conjunction with the National Family and Parenting Institute (NFPI) to:

  • bridge specific project findings into practice in the family support field; and
  • increase researchers’ knowledge transfer capacities.

Work on knowledge transfer stresses the social nature of two-way communication between researchers and users. The research group will collaborate with NFPI to influence family support practice and disseminate research findings, drawing on their extensive contacts with agencies working in the field and expertise in communicating practice-relevant material.

Direct and demonstrable impact of research findings on practice is rare, while diffuse and subtle influence is widespread. Outcomes from the project will:

  • in the short term – increase the group’s consultation with and provision of information to users; and
  • in the longer term – increase the group’s output in practitioner-focused forums and diffusion of research findings into practice thinking.
